TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When you read Jovian (damnit, English, why do you insist on using so many Latin adjectives?) as Joolian and barely even notice the difference

Honestly, I once forgot that the moon existed and it was the Mun. I was playing about 3 hours a day for a month though...

And

When you switch to 64-bit system only because of KSP memory issues

I got ubuntu just for KSP, now I have to shut down my computer to switch from KSP to other games. Ubuntu doesn't like Counter-Strike.

Edited August 8, 2015 by legoclone09
... when you sleep talk about launching rockets to your fiancee. Jebus!
When you drive by the exit you were supposed to get off at and think, "Oh it's ok, I'll just quickload back"...didn't work...
When you carry a notebook everywhere, so you can scribble down KSP ideas on the go.

When you carry a notebook everywhere, so you can scribble down KSP ideas on the go.

I disagree. I carry a pen and paper in me pocket everywhere i go to design me space stations or remotetech networks and even designed my figaro gps network during a long commute, yet i don't think i play KSP enough.

/Iz
You know longer use km/h. It's m/s all the way

You know longer use km/h. It's m/s all the way

Yeah, same for me. I like m/s more.
When you start talking to the Kerbals during a game.
When you trip over Earth's ground scatter forgetting it's not a physics-less mesh.

When your sister glues a leaf to her door and you think:

"Silly her. There is no 11th plague of Australia. Wait, why didn't I think something Kerbal?"
I too have noticed, thanks to KSP, Minecraft, and a few other games, that I think in meters and m/s now. If only I could program my GPS to use m/s for speed measurements :\

I too have noticed, thanks to KSP, Minecraft, and a few other games, that I think in meters and m/s now. If only I could program my GPS to use m/s for speed measurements :\

You could perhaps make it divide everything by 3.6? ;-)
When you think pro gaming is the opposite of retro gaming.
When you look at something like your car, or your van and shudder at the part count.

When you're starting to count errors in space theme rides videos..

like this one:

When you're starting to count errors in space theme rides videos..like this one:
"Such an erratic path would seem impossible with orbital mechanics, and going that fast in a few seconds would probably be beyond the capacity of the human body, and----" Edited August 10, 2015 by Columbia

When you are really annoyed by people around you who thinks that firing rockets skywards all the way will get you in space (Edit: and orbit) (and to the moon if you have enough fuel)

Edited August 10, 2015 by Jetenginestar

When you are really annoyed by people around you who thinks that firing rockets skywards all the way will get you in space (and to the moon if you have enough fuel)

Both of those things are technically true.
When the first thing you ask people is "Do you play Kerbal Space Program?"

When you are really annoyed by people around you who thinks that firing rockets skywards all the way will get you in space (and to the moon if you have enough fuel)
Both of those things are technically true.

Thats how I used to go to the mun

Minmus was harder but I managed.

This night I dreamt that I should adjust better my grappling hook to the asteroid center of gravity. Otherwise I would start spinning.

Does it qualify for madness??
When you try to go into map mode while lighting up zombies in Call of Duty.
When you decide to learn coding and electronics to build your own KSP Kontroller...
Pressing '.' on a boring youtube video.
